bib_record.title: .A detection system for (n,n') reaction studies of astrophysical interest.

free_txt: M.Segawa, Y.Temma, Y.Nagai, T.Masaki,
T.Shima, T.Ohta, A.Nakayoshi
J.Nishiyama, M.Igashira
Main Reference.
Method to prepare Li-7 targets.
The 3.2 MV Pelletron accelerator of the
Research Laboratory for Nuclear Reactors at the Tokyo
Institute of Technology.
Constant background subtracted from TOF
spectrum for Os,C and blank samples were obtained.
TOF spectrum for blank sample was subtracted from
that for Os and C to obtain net TOF spectrum, which
was used to define neutron energy spectrum for
osmium and carbon.
.Correction factors at EN 20.-40. keV Energy:
for multiple-scattering effects of incident neutrons
in Au sample     - 1.00,
in Os-186 sample - 1.01,
in C sample      - 1.01,
for shielding of incident neutrons
in Au sample     - 0.98,
in Os-186 sample - 0.96,
in C sample      - 0.95.
Four 6-Li glass detectors of 50 mm diameter and
10 mm thickness. Energy resolution 20%, defined by
measured energy spectrum of scattered neutron by gold
sample. Time resolution 1.5 nsec (FWHM) obtained from
TOF spectrum using gamma-ray from LI-7(p,gamma)Be-8
reaction. Detectors were surrounded by neutron shield
composed of boron-doped polyethylene blocks with
tapered collimator. Detector was set at 90deg. to
proton beam direction.
Li-6-glass detector of 5mm diameter and 5mm thickness
for monitoring of incident neutron energy spectrum.
Placed at 0deg. to proton beam direction,30cm downward
from neutron production target.
The 3.2 MV Pelletron accelerator of the
Research Laboratory for Nuclear Reactors at the Tokyo
Institute of Technology.
Li-7(p,n)Be-7 reaction. The proton energy was
adjusted so as to produce neutrons between 10 and
80 keV. Metallic layers of natural Li, evaporated onto
copper disk, thickness 0.4 mm cooled by water. Average
beam current of 5 microA at repetition rate 2 MHz.
Low-energy neutrons
Neutron production target - sample distance =2cm.
25/20 cm distance from sample to detectors.
TOF spectrums were measured 1)without sample,
2) with and without adding 0.4mm thick copper disk on
existing copper backing (0.4mm),
3) for water and air cooling for copper backing.
Measurement was carried out cyclically by
changing four samples of Os-186, Au, C and blank
position.
Details of detector
efficiency correction
Os-186 metallic powder of 0.34g weight and 99.55%
enrichment in Os-186. Gold sample of 0.19 g weight.
Sample was placed 2cm downward from Li-7 neutron
production target. Os,Au,C samples were wrapped by
aramid sheet of 4 microm thickness.
Presented uncertainty of 5.%
Statistical error of yield.
Uncertainty of elastic scattering cross
section for carbon.
.Fig.8 and text p.376 of Main Reference.
